windows.name: Oops!
description:
Warning

You cannot run an iOS mobile application on Windows.

mac.name: Install Homebrew
description:
What is Homebrew?

Homebrew is a free, open-source software package management system that simplifies the installation of software on the Mac OS X operating system. We recommend Homebrew for its ease of use as well as its simple integration using the command line.

Installation

To install Homebrew, run this code in the Terminal:

ruby -e "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/master/install)"

mac.name: Install Xcode
description:
What is Xcode?

Xcode includes the libraries you need to create and emulate mobile apps for iPhone, iPad, Mac, and Apple Watch.

Installation

Download Xcode from the Mac App Store and install it.

mac.name: Install Node.js
description:
What is Node.js?

Node.js is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine that includes the npm package manager.

Installation

Download Node.js and install it.

mac.name: Install Cordova
description:
What is Cordova?

Apache Cordova is a set of device APIs that allow you to access native device functions, such as the camera and accelerometer, using JavaScript.

Installation

To install Apache Cordova, use the Node Package Manager (npm) that is provided by Node.js:

  1. Open the Terminal.
  2. Run this command:
    npm install -g cordova

mac.name: Install Ionic
description:
What is Ionic?

Ionic offers you a command line layer to build mobile hybrid apps using HTML5 and AngularJS. Ionic also provides you with a complete front-end stack that focuses on building a cross-platform mobile user experience.

Installation

To install Ionic, use the Node Package Manager (npm) that is provided by Node.js:

  1. Open the Terminal.
  2. Run this command:
    npm install -g ionic

    NOTE: If NPM command returns an error, run: 

    sudo npm install -g ionic

mac.name: End
description:
Additional Information

If you have any further questions, please contact us at support@wakanda.io.

windows.name: Install Node.js
description:
What is Node.js?

Node.js is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine that includes the npm package manager.

Installation

Download Node.js and install it.

You must restart Wakanda Studio after completing this step.

windows.name: Install Cordova
description:
What is Cordova?

Apache Cordova is a set of device APIs that allow you to access native device functions, such as the camera and accelerometer, using JavaScript.

Installation

To install Apache Cordova, use the Node Package Manager (npm) that is provided by Node.js:

  1. Open the Terminal (start -> run: cmd.exe).
  2. Run this command:
    npm install -g cordova

windows.name: Install Ionic
description:
What is Ionic?

Ionic offers you a command line layer to build mobile hybrid apps using HTML5 and AngularJS. Ionic also provides you with a complete front-end stack that focuses on building a cross-platform mobile user experience.

Installation

To install Ionic, use the Node Package Manager (npm) that is provided by Node.js:

  1. Open the Terminal.
  2. Run this command:
    npm install -g ionic

NOTE: If the NPM command returns an error, run sudo npm install -g ionic

windows.name: Install Java JDK
description:
What is Java JDK?

Java Standard Edition Development Kit (JDK) is a development environment for building applications, applets, and components using the Java programming language.
The JDK includes tools useful for developing and testing programs written in the Java and running on the Java platform. The JDK includes the JRE so that you do not have to download them separately.

Installation

Download Java Platform JDK and install it.

Configuration

To configure Java JDK:

  1. Add a new user variable named JAVA_HOME whose value is the following:
    C:\Program Files\Java\jdk-version-folder
  2. Edit your PATH user variable by adding to it the following text at the beginning:
    %JAVA_HOME%\bin;

For more information, please refer to the documentation.

You must restart Wakanda Studio after completing this step.

windows.name: Install Apache Ant
description:
What is Apache Ant?

Apache Ant is a Java library and command line tool whose goal is to drive processes described in build files as targets and extension points that are dependent upon each other. Ant is mainly used to build Java applications. Ant supplies a number of built-in tasks that allow you to compile, assemble, test, and run Java applications. Ant can also be used effectively to build non-Java applications, like C or C++ applications. More generally, Ant can be used to pilot any type of process that can be described in terms of targets and tasks.

Installation

  1. Download Apache Ant binary files.
  2. Unzip the folder and move it to your Program Files folder:
    C:\Program Files\apache-ant-1.9.6

Configuration

Edit your PATH user variable by adding the following text at the beginning:

C:\Program Files\apache-ant-1.9.6\bin;

For more information, please refer to the documentation.

You must restart Wakanda Studio after completing this step.

windows.name: Install Android SDK
description:
What is Android SDK?

The Android Software Development Kit (SDK) includes a comprehensive set of development tools. These include a debugger, libraries, a handset emulator based on QEMU, documentation, sample code, and tutorials.

Installation

To install the Android SDK:

  1. Download the installer and run it.
  2. Run the SDK manager as suggested. Then, at the end of the installation process, you can install:
    Tools
    Android 5.1.1 (API 22) or newer
    Extras

Configuration

To configure Android SDK:

  1. Add a new user variable named ANDROID_HOME with this value:
    % USERPROFILE%\AppData\Local\Android\android-sdk
  2. Edit your PATH user variable by adding the following text at the beginning:
    %ANDROID_HOME%\platform-tools;%ANDROID_HOME%\tools;

For more information, please refer to the documentation.

You must restart Wakanda Studio after completing this step.

Installation of Additional Components

Intel HAXM greatly improves the performances of Android emulator. To run the installer open your command line and run:

"%ANDROID_HOME%\extras\intel\Hardware_Accelerated_Execution_Manager\intelhaxm-android.exe"

more info here.

windows.name: Create AVD
description:
What is AVD?

The AVD Manager provides you with a graphical user interface that allows you to create and manage Android Virtual Devices (AVDs). AVDs are required by the Android Emulator.

Configuration

To configure an emulator:

  1. Open Android AVD in your command line and run:

    "%ANDROID_HOME%\AVD Manager.exe"
  2. Click Create and create a new virtual machine

For more information, refer to the AVD Manager.

windows.name: End
description:
Additional Information

If you have any further questions, please contact us at support@wakanda.io.

mac.name: Install Homebrew
description:

Homebrew is a free, open-source software package management system that simplifies the installation of software on the Mac OS X operating system. We recommend Homebrew for its ease of use as well as its simple integration using the command line.

Installation

ruby -e "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/master/install)"

Installation

  2. Run this command:

mac.name: Install Ionic
description:
What is Ionic?

Ionic offers you a command line layer to build mobile hybrid apps using HTML5 and AngularJS. Ionic also provides you with a complete front-end stack that focuses on building a cross-platform mobile user experience.

Installation

To install Ionic, use the Node Package Manager (npm) that is provided by Node.js:

mac.name: Install Java JDK
description:
What is Java JDK?

Java Standard Edition Development Kit (JDK) is a development environment for building applications, applets, and components using the Java programming language.
The JDK includes tools useful for developing and testing programs written in the Java programming language and running on the Java platform. The JDK includes JRE so you do not have to download them separately.

Installation

Download the Java Platform JDK from here and install it.

mac.name: Install Apache Ant
description:
What is Apache Ant?

Apache Ant is a Java library and command-line tool whose mission is to drive processes described in build files as targets and extension points dependent upon each other. The main known usage of Ant is the build of Java applications. Ant supplies a number of built-in tasks allowing to compile, assemble, test and run Java applications. Ant can also be used effectively to build non-Java applications, like C or C++ applications. More generally, Ant can be used to pilot any type of process that can be described in terms of targets and tasks.

Installation

To install Apache Ant, you can use brew in the Terminal:

brew install ant

mac.name: Install Android SDK
description:
What is Android SDK?

The Android Software Development Kit (SDK) includes a comprehensive set of development tools. These include a debugger, libraries, a handset emulator based on QEMU, documentation, sample code, and tutorials.

Installation

To install the Android SDK:

  1. Run brew in the Terminal window:

    brew install android-sdk
  2. Run the following in the Terminal:
    android
  3. From the SDK manager, install:
    Tools
    Android 5.1.1 (API 22) or newer
    Extras

Installation of Additional Components

Intel HAXM greatly improves the performance of the Android emulator. To run, open the following folder:

~/android-sdk-macosx/extras/intel/Hardware_Accelerated_Execution_Manager

Then, run the dmg installer. For more information, please refer to the Hardware Accelerated Execution Manager page.

mac.name: Create AVD
description:
What is AVD?

The AVD Manager provides you with a graphical user interface that allows you to create and manage Android Virtual Devices (AVDs). AVDs are required by the Android Emulator.

Configuration

To configure an emulator:

  1. Open Android AVD in your command line run:

    android avd
  2. Click Create and create a new virtual machine

For more inforomation, please refer to AVD Manager.

mac.name: End
description:
Additional Information

If you have any further questions, please contact us at support@wakanda.io.

issues.title: The platform I'm looking for is not listed.
description:
We support only iOS and Android for native mobile app development. For other platforms, like Windows Phone, you can create a web application with Wakanda and AngularJS.

Please contact us at support@wakanda.io and let us know which platform you need. We'll send you an email as soon an update is available.

issues.title: npm returns a red error that starts with 'npm ERR! Error: EACCES...'.
description:
Solution

Try running the same command prefixed by 'sudo'

Example

Instead of

npm install -g ionic

try

sudo npm install -g ionic

issues.title: npm returns a red error that starts with 'npm ERR! network connect ETIMEDOUT...'.
description:
Solution

In most cases, you might be behind a proxy or have bad network settings.
If you are behind a proxy, please make sure that the npm 'proxy' config is set properly.

Example

In the Terminal run

npm config set proxy http://proxy.company.com:8080
npm config set https-proxy http://proxy.company.com:8080

If you are working behind a proxy in a "windows" domain, add the domain name into the proxy url:

npm config set proxy http://domain%5Cuser:password@proxy.company.com:8080
npm config set https-proxy http://domain%5Cuser:password@proxy.company.com:8080

You need to encode the backslash as an http uri string: %5C

Additional Information

It could also be necessary to point the npm registry to the http source:

npm config set registry "http://registry.npmjs.org"
npm config set strict-ssl false

issues.title: The iOS emulator displays a blank white screen (OS X El Capitan and Xcode 7)
description:
Solution

Launch Xcode, open its Preferences then download the 'iOS 8.4 Simulator' component from the Downloads tab.

Once done, open the Devices window of Xcode then delete all the '9.0' simulators.

Additionally, you may need to run the following command within your mobile application folder:

ionic state reset
